Package socialmedia

Interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
SocialMediaPlatform
All Known Implementing Classes:
SocialMedia
public interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
extends java.io.Serializable
MiniSocialMediaPlatform interface. The no-argument constructor of a class implementing this interface should initialise the MiniSocialMediaPlatform as an empty platform with no initial accounts nor posts within it. For Solo submissions ONLY.

  • Method Summary

  • Method Details

    • createAccount

      int createAccount​(java.lang.String handle) throws IllegalHandleException, InvalidHandleException
      The method creates an account in the platform with the given handle.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      handle - account's handle.
      Returns:
      the ID of the created account.
      Throws:
      IllegalHandleException - if the handle already exists in the platform.
      InvalidHandleException - if the new handle is empty, has more than 30 characters, or has white spaces.

    • removeAccount

      void removeAccount​(int id) throws AccountIDNotRecognisedException
      The method removes the account with the corresponding ID from the platform. When an account is removed, all of their posts and likes should also be removed.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      id - ID of the account.
      Throws:
      AccountIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any account in the system.

    • changeAccountHandle

      void changeAccountHandle​(java.lang.String oldHandle, java.lang.String newHandle) throws HandleNotRecognisedException, IllegalHandleException, InvalidHandleException
      The method replaces the oldHandle of an account by the newHandle.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      oldHandle - account's old handle.
      newHandle - account's new handle.
      Throws:
      HandleNotRecognisedException - if the old handle does not match to any account in the system.
      IllegalHandleException - if the new handle already exists in the platform.
      InvalidHandleException - if the new handle is empty, has more than 30 characters, or has white spaces.

    • showAccount

      java.lang.String showAccount​(java.lang.String handle) throws HandleNotRecognisedException
      The method creates a formatted string summarising the stats of the account identified by the given handle. The template should be: 
       ID: [account ID]
 Handle: [account handle]
 Description: [account description]
 Post count: [total number of posts, including endorsements and replies]
 Endorse count: [sum of endorsements received by each post of this account]
      Parameters:
      handle - handle to identify the account.
      Returns:
      the account formatted summary.
      Throws:
      HandleNotRecognisedException - if the handle does not match to any account in the system.

    • createPost

      int createPost​(java.lang.String handle, java.lang.String message) throws HandleNotRecognisedException, InvalidPostException
      The method creates a post for the account identified by the given handle with the following message.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      handle - handle to identify the account.
      message - post message.
      Returns:
      the sequential ID of the created post.
      Throws:
      HandleNotRecognisedException - if the handle does not match to any account in the system.
      InvalidPostException - if the message is empty or has more than 100 characters.

    • endorsePost

      int endorsePost​(java.lang.String handle, int id) throws HandleNotRecognisedException, PostIDNotRecognisedException, NotActionablePostException
      The method creates an endorsement post of an existing post, similar to a retweet on Twitter. An endorsement post is a special post. It contains a reference to the endorsed post and its message is formatted as:

      "EP@" + [endorsed account handle] + ": " + [endorsed message]

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      handle - of the account endorsing a post.
      id - of the post being endorsed.
      Returns:
      the sequential ID of the created post.
      Throws:
      HandleNotRecognisedException - if the handle does not match to any account in the system.
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any post in the system.
      NotActionablePostException - if the ID refers to a endorsement post. Endorsement posts are not endorsable. Endorsements are not transitive. For instance, if post A is endorsed by post B, and an account wants to endorse B, in fact, the endorsement must refers to A.

    • commentPost

      int commentPost​(java.lang.String handle, int id, java.lang.String message) throws HandleNotRecognisedException, PostIDNotRecognisedException, NotActionablePostException, InvalidPostException
      The method creates a comment post referring to an existing post, similarly to a reply on Twitter. A comment post is a special post. It contains a reference to the post being commented upon.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      handle - of the account commenting a post.
      id - of the post being commented.
      message - the comment post message.
      Returns:
      the sequential ID of the created post.
      Throws:
      HandleNotRecognisedException - if the handle does not match to any account in the system.
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any post in the system.
      NotActionablePostException - if the ID refers to a endorsement post. Endorsement posts are not endorsable. Endorsements cannot be commented. For instance, if post A is endorsed by post B, and an account wants to comment B, in fact, the comment must refers to A.
      InvalidPostException - if the comment message is empty or has more than 100 characters.

    • deletePost

      void deletePost​(int id) throws PostIDNotRecognisedException
      The method removes the post from the platform. When a post is removed, all its endorsements should be removed as well. All replies to this post should be updated by replacing the reference to this post by a generic empty post.

      The generic empty post message should be "The original content was removed from the system and is no longer available.". This empty post is just a replacement placeholder for the post which a reply refers to. Empty posts should not be linked to any account and cannot be acted upon, i.e., it cannot be available for endorsements or replies.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      id - ID of post to be removed.
      Throws:
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any post in the system.

    • showIndividualPost

      java.lang.String showIndividualPost​(int id) throws PostIDNotRecognisedException
      The method generates a formated string containing the details of a single post. The format is as follows: 
       ID: [post ID]
 Account: [account handle]
 No. endorsements: [number of endorsements received by the post] | No. comments: [number of comments received by the post]
 [post message]
      Parameters:
      id - of the post to be shown.
      Returns:
      a formatted string containing post's details.
      Throws:
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any post in the system.

    • showPostChildrenDetails

      java.lang.StringBuilder showPostChildrenDetails​(int id) throws PostIDNotRecognisedException, NotActionablePostException
      The method builds a StringBuilder showing the details of the current post and all its children posts. The format is as follows: 
       showIndividualPost(id)
 |
 [for reply: replies to the post sorted by ID]
 |  > showIndividualPost(reply)
      See an example: 
       ID: 1
 Account: user1
 No. endorsements: 2 | No. comments: 3
 I like examples.
 |
 | > ID: 3
     Account: user2
     No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 1
     No more than me...
     |
     | > ID: 5
         Account: user1
         No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 1
         I can prove!
         |                                         
         | > ID: 6                                 
             Account: user2                        
             No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 0 
             prove it                    
 | > ID: 4
     Account: user3
     No. endorsements: 4 | No. comments: 0
     Can't you do better than this?
 
 | > ID: 7
     Account: user5
     No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 1
     where is the example?
     |
     | > ID: 10
         Account: user1
         No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 0
         This is the example!
      Continuing with the example, if the method is called for post ID=5 (showIndividualPost(5)), the return would be: 
       ID: 5
 Account: user1
 No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 1
 I can prove!
 |                                         
 | > ID: 6                                 
     Account: user2                        
     No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 0 
     prove it
      Parameters:
      id - of the post to be shown.
      Returns:
      a formatted StringBuilder containing the details of the post and its children.
      Throws:
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - if the ID does not match to any post in the system.
      NotActionablePostException - if the ID refers to an endorsement post. Endorsement posts do not have children since they are not endorsable nor commented.

    • getMostEndorsedPost

      int getMostEndorsedPost()
      This method identifies and returns the post with the most number of endorsements, a.k.a. the most popular post.
      Returns:
      the ID of the most popular post.

    • getMostEndorsedAccount

      int getMostEndorsedAccount()
      This method identifies and returns the account with the most number of endorsements, a.k.a. the most popular account.
      Returns:
      the ID of the most popular account.

    • erasePlatform

      void erasePlatform()
      Method empties this SocialMediaPlatform of its contents and resets all internal counters.

    • savePlatform

      void savePlatform​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException
      Method saves this SocialMediaPlatform's contents into a serialised file, with the filename given in the argument.
      Parameters:
      filename - location of the file to be saved
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a problem experienced when trying to save the store contents to the file

    • loadPlatform

      void loadPlatform​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      Method should load and replace this SocialMediaPlatform's contents with the serialised contents stored in the file given in the argument.

      The state of this SocialMediaPlatform's must be be unchanged if any exceptions are thrown.

      Parameters:
      filename - location of the file to be loaded
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is a problem experienced when trying to load the store contents from the file
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if required class files cannot be found when loading
